posts.post_content: @DeathDark, I run [Pawn of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pawn of Ulamog) with [Butcher of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Butcher of Malakir) and I'll tell you your combo does not work. Pawn of Ulamog's ability only activates when a nontoken creature YOU control is put into the graveyard. Therefore, you cannot infinitely combo the two cards. However, throwing in [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton) and [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire). Attack with allows you to sack the Skeleton, triggering both Butcher and Pawn's ability, upon which you get a spawn and he/she sacks a creature. Sack the spawn and Butcher's ability procs again, leaving you with a 5/5 Bloodthrone vampire and two less enemy creatures. Oh, you can repeat for a colorless/black mana too.
posts.html:
@DeathDark, I run Pawn of Ulamog with Butcher of Malakir and I'll tell you your combo does not work. Pawn of Ulamog's ability only activates when a nontoken creature YOU control is put into the graveyard. Therefore, you cannot infinitely combo the two cards. However, throwing in Reassembling Skeleton and Bloodthrone Vampire. Attack with allows you to sack the Skeleton, triggering both Butcher and Pawn's ability, upon which you get a spawn and he/she sacks a creature. Sack the spawn and Butcher's ability procs again, leaving you with a 5/5 Bloodthrone vampire and two less enemy creatures. Oh, you can repeat for a colorless/black mana too.

posts.post_content:
i need a judge's ruling on this if i may. if you kill your magma phoenix equipped with basilisk collar, would you get the first token (from the phoenix going to the graveyard,) before or after the board is wiped by the phoenix? i assumed you choose which order the effects stack, since they activate at the same time :)  
  
also, it's a good idea, if using this combo, to enchant the vampire with a totem-armor aura, and equip with the blade of the blood-chief, to make him super powerful and live thru the phoenix destruction. probly best in a R/w/b deck i'd think.

posts.post_content: This + [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire). Sac creatures to produce tokens and boost Bloodthrone. You can sacrifice the tokens to boost Bloodthrone as well, or to build towards [Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre) or any other Eldrazi.

posts.post_content:
This guy is terrifying.... he makes a fantastic addition to vampire decks, since their all-out assault helps fuel his ability, which will allow them to drop bigger creatures as soon as possible.
  
   
I don't know if he will replace the [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) or [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) (both incredible cards), but for someone looking to make Eldrazzi work in their deck, this guy is a solid component.
  
   
4/5
posts.html:
This guy is terrifying.... he makes a fantastic addition to vampire decks, since their all-out assault helps fuel his ability, which will allow them to drop bigger creatures as soon as possible.

I don't know if he will replace the Gatekeeper of Malakir or Vampire Nighthawk (both incredible cards), but for someone looking to make Eldrazzi work in their deck, this guy is a solid component.

4/5

posts.post_content: just in case some of you do not know. tokens when they are destroyed. they are not put into the graveyard. not even for a brief amount of time. so most of the time tokens cant activate the, 'when a creature you control is sent to the graveyard from the battlefield" effect.

posts.post_content:
This is a combo machine, especially within sacrifice decks. Throw this guy down with the likes of Bloodthrone Vampire and some cheap little one drops, like Death Cultist, and Reassembling Skeleton for repeat sacrificing, and you generate a solid mana base if you need it or a tool to power up your sac engines.  
Outside of decks that rely on sending your own creatures to the graveyard, this card isn't too useful. Limited power, but amazing potential in the correct deck. 4/5

posts.post_content:
You guys are boring. Let me show you how to black the Deck.  
  
You see, we first start off by achieving [Butcher of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Butcher of Malakir). Why? Because it's block, and life's funner in block. Then we acquire ourselves a Pawn. Why a Pawn? Because we're commenting on the card, and the tends to be in his combos.  
  
Now, sacrifice a creature. Or kill it, whatever. How do you do this? Oh, black has ways ([Bloodthrone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone) or [Viscera Seer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viscera Seer) work fine). Since you sacrificed a creature, Butcher's effect kicks. Since Butcher's effect comes into being, each opponent sacrifices a creature. You get an Eldrazi Spawn for each of these. You then sacrifice these tokens for mana. Are you going to use that mana? Who cares? Now everyone sacrifices that many creatures, because the Butcher said so. Now you get more tokens due to Pawn. If you're quite daft, reread this a few more times until it sinks in that you can repeat the process.  
  
Now, go black and... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
You guys are boring. Let me show you how to black the Deck.

You see, we first start off by achieving Butcher of Malakir. Why? Because it's block, and life's funner in block. Then we acquire ourselves a Pawn. Why a Pawn? Because we're commenting on the card, and the tends to be in his combos.

Now, sacrifice a creature. Or kill it, whatever. How do you do this? Oh, black has ways (Bloodthrone or Viscera Seer work fine). Since you sacrificed a creature, Butcher's effect kicks. Since Butcher's effect comes into being, each opponent sacrifices a creature. You get an Eldrazi Spawn for each of these. You then sacrifice these tokens for mana. Are you going to use that mana? Who cares? Now everyone sacrifices that many creatures, because the Butcher said so. Now you get more tokens due to Pawn. If you're quite daft, reread this a few more times until it sinks in that you can repeat the process.

Kind of reminds me [Rotlung reanimator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rotlung reanimator) which my buddy plays and which proved to be quite powerful if you don't get rid of him quickly.
  
0/1 creature doesn't mean harm on its own, but the extra mana you get from them is cool. Hard to decide which one is better ('course, Pawn here is more universal as he makes tokens from any creature, regardless of type).
